dataset.title: Code of Federal Regulations in XML
dataset.description: The Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) is the codification of the general and permanent rules published in the Federal Register by the executive departments and agencies of the Federal Government. It is divided into 50 titles that represent broad areas subject to Federal regulation. Each print volume of the CFR is updated once each calendar year, and is issued on a quarterly basis. Bulk data downloads of Code of Federal Regulations files in XML format are available from 1996 to the present, by year, title, and volume. The current XML data set is not yet an official format of the Code of Federal Regulations. Only the PDF and Text versions have legal status as parts of the official online format of the Code of Federal Regulations. The XML-structured files are derived from SGML-tagged data and printing codes, which may produce anomalies in display. In addition, the XML data does not yet include image files. Users who require a higher level of assurance may wish to consult the official version of the Code of Federal Regulations on Govinfo.gov. The FDsys data set includes digitally signed Code of Federal Regulations PDF files, which may be relied upon as evidence in a court of law. See: https://www.govinfo.gov/app/collection/cfr/

dataset.title: Electronic Code of Federal Regulations
dataset.description: The Electronic Code of Federal Regulations (e-CFR) is the codification of the general and permanent rules published in the Federal Register by the executive departments and agencies of the Federal Government. It is divided into 50 titles that represent broad areas subject to Federal regulation. The Electronic Code of Federal Regulations is updated daily. The Electronic Code of Federal Regulations and its accompanying XML data is not yet an official format of the Code of Federal Regulations. Only the PDF and Text versions of the annual Code of Federal Regulations have legal status as parts of the official online format of the Code of Federal Regulations. The XML-structured files are derived from SGML-tagged data and printing codes, which may produce anomalies in display. In addition, the XML data does not yet include image files. Users who require a higher level of assurance may wish to consult the official version of the Code of Federal Regulations or the daily Federal Register on FDsys.gov.

dataset.title: 2011 United States Government Manual in XML
dataset.description: As the official handbook of the Federal Government, the United States Government Manual provides comprehensive information on the agencies of the legislative, judicial, and executive branches. It also includes information on quasi-official agencies; international organizations in which the United States participates; and boards, commissions, and committees. The Manual begins with reprints of the Declaration of Independence and the U.S. Constitution. A typical agency description includes a list of officials heading major operating units, a summary statement of the agency's purpose and role in the Federal Government, a brief history of the agency, including its legislative or executive authority, and a description of its programs and activities, and information, addresses, and phone numbers to help users locate detailed information on consumer activities, contracts and grants, employment, publications, and other matters of public interest.

dataset.title: 2012 United States Government Manual in XML
dataset.description: As the official handbook of the Federal Government, the United States Government Manual provides comprehensive information on the agencies of the legislative, judicial, and executive branches. It also includes information on quasi-official agencies; international organizations in which the United States participates; and boards, commissions, and committees. The Manual begins with reprints of the Declaration of Independence and the U.S. Constitution. A typical agency description includes a list of officials heading major operating units, a summary statement of the agency's purpose and role in the Federal Government, a brief history of the agency, including its legislative or executive authority, and a description of its programs and activities, and information, addresses, and phone numbers to help users locate detailed information on consumer activities, contracts and grants, employment, publications, and other matters of public interest.

dataset.title: 2014 Federal Register in XML
dataset.description: The Federal Register is the official daily publication for rules, proposed rules, and notices of Federal agencies and organizations, as well as executive orders and other presidential documents. Published by the Office of the Federal Register (OFR), National Archives and Records Administration (NARA), it is updated daily and is available Monday through Friday, except Federal holidays. Bulk data downloads of Federal Register files in XML format are available from 2000 to the present, by year, month, and day. The current XML data set is not yet an official format of the Federal Register. Only the PDF and Text versions have legal status as parts of the official online format of the Federal Register. The XML-structured files are derived from SGML-tagged data and printing codes, which may produce anomalies in display. In addition, the XML data does not yet include image files. Users who require a higher level of assurance may wish to consult the official version of the Federal Register on FDsys.gov. The FDsys data set includes digitally signed Federal Register PDF files, which may be relied upon as evidence in a court of law. See: https://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/browse/collection.action?collectionCode=FR

dataset.title: 2015 Federal Register in XML
dataset.description: The Federal Register is the official daily publication for rules, proposed rules, and notices of Federal agencies and organizations, as well as executive orders and other presidential documents. Published by the Office of the Federal Register (OFR), National Archives and Records Administration (NARA), it is updated daily and is available Monday through Friday, except Federal holidays. Bulk data downloads of Federal Register files in XML format are available from 2000 to the present, by year, month, and day. The current XML data set is not yet an official format of the Federal Register. Only the PDF and Text versions have legal status as parts of the official online format of the Federal Register. The XML-structured files are derived from SGML-tagged data and printing codes, which may produce anomalies in display. In addition, the XML data does not yet include image files. Users who require a higher level of assurance may wish to consult the official version of the Federal Register on FDsys.gov. The FDsys data set includes digitally signed Federal Register PDF files, which may be relied upon as evidence in a court of law. See: https://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/browse/collection.action?collectionCode=FR

The current XML data set is not yet an official format of the Federal Register. Only the PDF and Text versions have legal status as parts of the official online format of the Federal Register. The XML-structured files are derived from SGML-tagged data and printing codes, which may produce anomalies in display. In addition, the XML data does not yet include image files. The FDsys data set includes digitally signed Federal Register PDF files, which may be relied upon as evidence in a court of law. See: https://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/browse/collection.action?collectionCode=FR

dataset.title: 2013 United States Government Manual in XML
dataset.description: As the official handbook of the Federal Government, the United States Government Manual provides comprehensive information on the agencies of the legislative, judicial, and executive branches. It also includes information on quasi-official agencies; international organizations in which the United States participates; and boards, commissions, and committees. The Manual begins with reprints of the Declaration of Independence and the U.S. Constitution. A typical agency description includes a list of officials heading major operating units, a summary statement of the agency's purpose and role in the Federal Government, a brief history of the agency, including its legislative or executive authority, and a description of its programs and activities, and information, addresses, and phone numbers to help users locate detailed information on consumer activities, contracts and grants, employment, publications, and other matters of public interest.

dataset.title: Access to Archival Databases (AAD)
dataset.description: AAD provides web access to accessioned electronic Records that are in database format.

dataset.title: Amending America: Proposed Amendments to the United States Constitution, 1787 to 2014
dataset.description:
This dataset provides information about more than 11,000 proposed Constitutional amendments introduced in the United States Congress from 1787 to 2014. This dataset is a compilation of information from several Congressional publications as well as a search for Constitutional amendments on the Congress.gov website.

Data available for each proposed amendment varies by source publication. Each entry may include a source of information, title or description of amendment, date of introduction, Congress, Congressional session, joint resolution number, sponsor name, sponsor state or territory, and the committee of referral.

The National Archives and Records Administration created this dataset as part of the Amending America initiative. To prepare for the 2016 "Amending America" exhibition at the National Archives Museum in Washington, D.C., NARA volunteers and staff transcribed and edited over 11,000 entries representing proposed amendments to the U.S. Constitution, as recorded by Congress.

distribution.title: Amending America: Proposed Amendments to the United States Constitution, 1787 to 2014
distribution.description: This webpage describes and hosts the dataset for more than 11,000 proposed Amendments to the United States Constitution.

distribution.title: Amending America: Proposed Amendments to the United States Constitution, 1788 to 2014 - RAW
distribution.description: This document is the comma-separated values (CSV) version of more than 11,000 proposed amendments to the United States Constitution.

dataset.title: Archival Electronic Records Inspection and Control
dataset.description: AERIC preserves the logical structure of databases, and verifies that the records received are those supported by the accompanying documentation.
dataset.rights: This system contains non-public use datasets, which are reviewed and processed to create public use versions, which are available through NARA's online systems.

dataset.title: Archival Records Center Information System
dataset.description: ARCIS automates, centralizes and standardizes the Records Center business processes
dataset.rights: This system is used by Federal records managers to manage the transfer and disposition of agency federal records stored in NARA facilities.  Because of the way agencies, such as IRS, transfer and recall records, this system contains PII.

dataset.title: Archival Descriptions from the National Archives Catalog
dataset.description: Archival Descriptions from the National Archives Catalog data set provides archival descriptions of the permanent holdings of the federal government in the custody of the National Archives and Records administration. The archival descriptions include information on traditional paper holdings, logical data records (electronic records), and artifacts.

distribution.title: Archival Descriptions Data File Webpage
distribution.description: On this page, you can access the XML dataset in 22 parts.

dataset.title: Archives.gov
dataset.description: Archives.gov is the National Archives' main public-facing website.

dataset.title: Archives Library Information Center
dataset.description: ALIC is an online library catalog of books, periodicals, and other materials contained in Archives I and II and book collections located in other facilities.

dataset.title: Badging and Access System
dataset.description: This system supports badging and enforces the levels of building access to Archives 1 and Archives 2 only.
dataset.rights: This system contains access control information for NARA facilities, including PII and information about NARA's physical security controls.

dataset.title: Case Analysis Tracking System
dataset.description: CATS tracks Public and Federal Agency Reference Requests for OPF (Official Personnel Folder) , EMF (Employee Medical Folder), and eOPF (electronic Official Personnel Folder) Records.
dataset.rights: This system is searched by the last four digits of the social security number to allow staff to locate civilian personnel records in NARA's custody in response to access requests as well as track incoming work by agency for billing purposes.

dataset.title: Case Management and Reporting System
dataset.description: CMRS provides improved workload management and processes related to fulfilling requests for military Records.
dataset.rights: This system is searched by social security number or military id number to allow NARA staff to locate military personnel records and health records.

dataset.title: Digital Preservation Framework
dataset.description:
The idea of the “Semantic Web” for the internet is that organizations and individuals can share information in a format that can be read automatically by computers, and can link similar types of information across multiple web sites. This collection of related datasets on the web is referred to as Linked Open Data.

The National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) has a long history of releasing information about its collections available as datasets and making information machine-accessible through Application Programming Interfaces (APIs).

NARA’s Digital Preservation Unit has been collaborating closely with colleagues at other national archives and libraries as well as with the WikiData for Digital Preservation initiative to make our Digital Preservation Framework available as a Linked Open Data Resource to complement the preservation plans made available on GitHub. The Framework provides Preservation Plans for several hundred formats, including links to specifications and standards, links to community documentation about the formats, and NARA’s proposed preservation actions and tools.

Please Note Attribution:  Attribution 2.0 Generic (CC BY 2.0)
dataset.rights: true

dataset.title: Electronic Document Management System
dataset.description: e-DOCS is a system that automates the creation of the daily Federal Register.  This also includes the Emergency Federal Register.
dataset.rights: This is non-public system that produced the Federal Register and associated publications.

dataset.title: Electronic Records Archives
dataset.description: ERA system preserves electronic Records.
dataset.rights: This system contains unprocess, unreviewed, accessioned electronic records.  Public use versions are made through NARA's Online Public Access System, available at: https://www.archives.gov/research/search/

dataset.title: Executive Orders from 1994-Present
dataset.description: The President of the United States manages the operations of the Executive branch of Government through Executive orders. After the President signs an Executive order, the White House sends it to the Office of the Federal Register (OFR). The OFR numbers each order consecutively as part of a series, and publishes it in the daily Federal Register shortly after receipt.
dataset.rights: true

distribution.title: Executive Orders--1994 to present
distribution.description: This dataset includes all Executive orders issued from 1994-present. It is updated in real time.

distribution.title: Executive Orders--Barack H. Obama
distribution.description: This dataset includes all Executive orders issued by Barack Obama. It also includes cross-references to previous Executive orders.

keyword: executive orders government president white house barack obama george w bush william j clinton

dataset.description: The President of the United States manages the operations of the Executive branch of Government through Executive orders. After the President signs an Executive order, the White House sends it to the Office of the Federal Register (OFR). The OFR numbers each order consecutively as part of a series, and publishes it in the daily Federal Register shortly after receipt.

dataset.title: Federal Register in XML
dataset.description: The Federal Register is the official daily publication for rules, proposed rules, and notices of Federal agencies and organizations, as well as executive orders and other presidential documents. Published by the Office of the Federal Register (OFR), National Archives and Records Administration (NARA), it is updated daily and is available Monday through Friday, except Federal holidays. GPO's Government Information System (govinfo) contains Federal Register issues from 1936 to the present. The current XML data set is not yet an official format of the Federal Register. The XML-structured files are derived from SGML-tagged data and printing codes, which may produce anomalies in display. In addition, the XML data does not yet include image files. Users who require a higher level of assurance may wish to consult the official version of the Federal Register on govinfo.gov or federalregister.gov. The govinfo data set includes digitally signed Federal Register PDF files, which may be relied upon as evidence in a court of law.

dataset.title: FederalRegister.gov and API
dataset.description: Website and API containing the daily Federal Register.

dataset.title: General Records Schedules (GRS)
dataset.description:
The General Records Schedules (GRS) are issued by the Archivist of the United States to provide agencies with disposition authority for records common to several or all Federal Government agencies. These schedules authorize (36 CFR 1227.10), after specified periods of time, the destruction of temporary records or the transfer of permanent records to the National Archives of the United States (NARA). “The GRS” refers to the entire set of schedules, but “GRS” is also commonly used to refer to a single schedule within the whole.

The data is 45 comma-separated values (CSV) files, one for each schedule in GRS Transmittal 30 (December 2019), plus a data dictionary listing the fields exported from ERA, and a brief feedback survey.

publisher.name: Office of the Chief Records Officer, Operations Research and Support Team

distribution.title: General Records Schedules (GRS)
distribution.description:
The General Records Schedules (GRS) are issued by the Archivist of the United States to provide agencies with disposition authority for records common to several or all Federal Government agencies. These schedules authorize (36 CFR 1227.10), after specified periods of time, the destruction of temporary records or the transfer of permanent records to the National Archives of the United States (NARA). “The GRS” refers to the entire set of schedules, but “GRS” is also commonly used to refer to a single schedule within the whole.

The data is 45 comma-separated values (CSV) files, one for each schedule in GRS Transmittal 30 (December 2019), plus a data dictionary listing the fields exported from ERA, and a brief feedback survey.

dataset.title: Holdings Management System
dataset.description: This system supports the physical management of permanent, hard-copy archival Records in the custody of National Archives and Records Administration program offices.
dataset.rights: This system has non-public components, including information about storage and security of archival assets.  Public information is exported from this database and available in NARA research rooms.

dataset.title: Founders Online Metadata
dataset.description:
CORRESPONDENCE AND OTHER WRITINGS OF SIX MAJOR SHAPERS OF THE UNITED STATES:
George Washington, Benjamin Franklin, John Adams (and family), Thomas Jefferson, Alexander Hamilton, and James Madison. Over 180,000 searchable documents, fully annotated, from the authoritative Founding Fathers Papers projects.
dataset.rights: This is a Non-Federal dataset covered by different Terms of Use than Data.gov

distribution.title: Founders Online Website
distribution.description: This is the website that contains correspondence and other writings of six major shapers of the United States: George Washington, Benjamin Franklin, John Adams (and family), Thomas Jefferson, Alexander Hamilton, and James Madison. Over 180,000 searchable documents, fully annotated, from the authoritative Founding Fathers Papers projects.

dataset.title: Interagency Security Classification Appeals Panel (ISCAP) Decisions
dataset.description: This online collection includes documents decided upon by the Interagency Security Classification Appeals Panel (ISCAP) starting in Fiscal Year 2012. The documents include records from the Presidential Library system of the National Archives, the Central Intelligence Agency, National Security Agency, the Department of Defense, and other agencies.  The quality of theimages is dependent on the quality of the original records used to create the copies provided to the Panel.

dataset.title: Internal Collaboration Network
dataset.description: ICN is a social business software tool for National Archives and Records Administration staff.
dataset.rights: This system is part of NARA's internal business processes and contains deliberative process information. To the extent that agency policy and final decisions are created on this platform, they are made public through other means, such as Archives.gov.

dataset.title: NARA Enterprise Data Inventory
dataset.description: NARA's Enterprise Data Inventory contains public and non-public data assets.  These include data assets, public APIs, and internal NARA systems.

distribution.title: Open Data at the National Archives

dataset.title: NARA Public Data Listing
dataset.description: NARA's Public Data Listing contains data assets that are available to the public.  These include datasets in a variety of formats and public APIs.

dataset.title: National Archives and Records Administration Donor/Gift Records Management System
dataset.description: This system tracks gifts and donations to National Archives and Records Administration.
dataset.rights: This system manages NARA's development activities and contains PII about donors.

dataset.title: National Historical Publications and Records Commission (NHPRC) Grants, 1965-Present
dataset.description: Grants awarded by the National Historical Publications and Records Commission (NHPRC) in support of history and archives projects.

distribution.title: NHPRC Grants Dataset Webpage

dataset.title: Public Papers of the Presidents of the United States in XML - Obama
dataset.description: The Public Papers of the Presidents, which is compiled and published by the Office of the Federal Register, National Archives and Records Administration, began in 1957 in response to a recommendation of the National Historical Publications Commission. Noting the lack of uniform compilations of messages and papers of the Presidents before this time, the Commission recommended the establishment of an official series in which Presidential writings, addresses, and remarks of a public nature could be made available.

distribution.title: Webpage for the Public Papers of the Presidents
distribution.description: This webpage provides access to the Public Papers of the Presidents for Barack H. Obama (XML & PDF), George W. Bush (PDF & Text), William J. Clinton (PDF & Text), and George H. W. Bush (PDF & Text).

Presidential Documents Published in the Federal Register

dataset.title: OGIS Access System
dataset.description: The OGIS Access System (OAS) provides case management, stakeholder collaboration, and public communications activities including a web presence via a web portal.
dataset.rights: There are non-public components of the OGIS Access System that are not publicly available, which include Personally Identifiable Information and deliberative process information. Public components of this dataset are available at https://ogis.archives.gov

dataset.title: National Archives Catalog and API
dataset.description: The National Archives Catalog is the online catalog of NARA's nationwide holdings in the Washington, DC area, Regional Archives, and Presidential Libraries.

distribution.title: Home page for the National Archives Catalog.
distribution.description: At this site you can search the records of the National Archives, including millions of digitized images and archival descriptions.

distribution.title: API for the National Archives Catalog

dataset.title: Order Fulfillment and Accounting System
dataset.description: OFAS is the financial management system that tracks and provides accounting of customer service requests for reproductions of National Archives and Records Administration holdings and other National Archives and Records Administration products.
dataset.rights: This system contains finacial information related to transactions between researchers and NARA's Trust Fund.

dataset.title: Organization Descriptions from the National Archives Catalog
dataset.description: The Organization Authority Files data set contains a highly detailed presentation of the evolution of names and administrative histories of Federal and non-Federal organizations. It is used by the National Archives and Records Administration as a source of access points for indexing archival descriptions and/or other authority records with consistent headings.

dataset.title: Performance Measurement and Reporting System
dataset.description: PMRS is a data warehouse that collects data critical to the analysis of progress on strategic and annual performance plans.
dataset.rights: Public components of this dataset are available at: https://www.archives.gov/about/plans-reports/performance-accountability/. Further evaluation of this dataset for privacy information is necessary before the entire dataset is made public.

distribution.title: Annual Performance Plans and Reports web page

dataset.title: Presidential Electronic Records Library
dataset.description: PERL (Presidential Electronic Records Library) used to ingest and provide internal access to the Presidential electronic Records of the Reagan, Bush, and Clinton administrations.
dataset.rights: This systems contains electronic presidential records transferred from the Reagan, Bush, and Clinton adminstrations.  These records are subject to Presidential Records Act review and contain PII and other non-public sensitive information.

dataset.title: Presidential Network
dataset.description: PRESNET is used by the Ford Presidential Library to automate a series of life-cycle functions ranging from tracking the solicitation of donations of papers to accessioning, description, and item transfers and withdrawals.
dataset.rights: This system contains accessioning and processing information as well as workflow information related to management of the Presidential records in the Ford Library.  Public information from this system is exported and made available to researchers.

dataset.title: Privacy Act Issuances - Bulk XML
dataset.description: The Privacy Act Compilation contains descriptions of Federal agency systems of records maintained on individuals and procedures Federal agencies follow to assist individuals who request information about their records. It contains individual Privacy Act system descriptions and their governing regulations.

dataset.title: Records About Japanese Americans Relocated During World War II
dataset.description: This series contains personal descriptive data about Japanese Americans evacuated from the states of Washington, Oregon, and California to ten relocation centers operated by the War Relocation Authority during World War II in the states of California (Tule Lake and Manzanar Centers), Idaho (Minidoka Center), Utah (Central Utah Center), Colorado (Granada Center), Arizona (Colorado River and Gila River Centers), Wyoming (Heart Mountain Center), and Arkansas (Rohwer and Jerome Centers). Each record represents an individual and includes the name; relocation project and assembly center to which assigned; previous address; birthplace of parents; occupation of father; education; foreign residence; indication of military service, public assistance, pensions, and physical defects; sex and marital status; race of evacuee and spouse; year of birth; age; birthplace; indication of the holding of an alien registration number and/or Social Security number, and whether the evacuee attended Japanese language school; highest grade completed; language proficiency; occupations; and religion.

distribution.title: Catalog description for the Japanese-American Internee Data File

dataset.title: Records Center Program Billing System
dataset.description: RCPBS supports the Records center programs (RCP) in producing invoices for the storage (NARS-5) and servicing of National Archives and Records Administrationâs Regional Records Centers.  The transaction level billing for services is obtained through the regions via web interface.
dataset.rights: This system contains finacial and billing information used to collect funds from other federal agencies.

dataset.title: Records Control Schedules Repository
dataset.description: The Records Control Schedules (RCS) repository provides access to scanned versions of records schedules, or Standard Form 115, Request for Records Disposition Authority, that have been developed by Federal agencies and approved by the Archivist of the United States.

distribution.title: Records Control Schedules Portal web page

dataset.title: Researcher Registration System
dataset.description: Automated system that manages the researcher application, registration, and access process in Archives I and II.
dataset.rights: This system tracks researchers who use NARA records and includes researcher PII.

dataset.title: Security Clearance Tracking System
dataset.description: SCTS supports the adjudication process of private background investigations and clearances for potential employees, contractors, interns and student workers.
dataset.rights: This system contains personnel information regarding background and security investigations of NARA employees and contractors.

dataset.title: Social Media Channels and Statistics at the National Archives
dataset.description: More than 100 social media channels and statistics for the National Archives and Records Administration.

dataset.title: Presidential Libraries Museum Collection Management Database
dataset.description: MCMD serves as a descriptive catalog for the Presidential Libraries museum collections, and also supports a full range of museum collections management processes according to national, international and NARA standards and best practices for two-and three-dimensional artifact collections.
dataset.rights: This is a collection management database used by the Presidential Libraries to manage artifacts, donations, and other materials. This system can contain PII about donors.

dataset.title: Unclassified Redaction and Tracking System (URTS)
dataset.description: URTS extends the ADRRES system for the processing of UNCLASSIFIED Federal Records, including sensitive materials to be redacted.
dataset.rights: This system is used to generate public use documents from non-public versions of the records in response to FOIA and access requests.

dataset.title: United States Government Manual in XML
dataset.description: As the official handbook of the Federal Government, the United States Government Manual provides comprehensive information on the agencies of the legislative, judicial, and executive branches. It also includes information on quasi-official agencies; international organizations in which the United States participates; and boards, commissions, and committees. The Manual begins with reprints of the Declaration of Independence and the U.S. Constitution. A typical agency description includes a list of officials heading major operating units, a summary statement of the agency's purpose and role in the Federal Government, a brief history of the agency, including its legislative or executive authority, and a description of its programs and activities, and information, addresses, and phone numbers to help users locate detailed information on consumer activities, contracts and grants, employment, publications, and other matters of public interest.

distribution.title: Webpage for US Government Manual Bulk Data download
distribution.description: This webpage contains all available US Government Manual editions.

dataset.title: Visitor Ticketing Application
dataset.description: VISTA system makes reservations and accepts credit card payment for tours at Presidential libraries.
dataset.rights: This system contains finacial information related to transactions between vistors and Presidential Libraries.

dataset.title: White House Tapes of the Nixon Administration, 1971 to 1973
dataset.description: This dataset provides information about the Nixon Administration's White House Tapes.  The White House Tapes contain sound recordings of President Richard Nixon's telephone calls and meetings recorded at the White House in Washington, D.C. and the Presidential retreat at Camp David, Maryland.   These recordings document many of the major events and decisions of the Nixon Administration from February 16, 1971 to July 18, 1973.  This dataset offers details for all 22,723 conversations, including title, time and date of recording, recording device, geographic coordinates, parent audiotape, participants, and a brief descriptive statement.

contactPoint.fn: Tapes Team, Nixon Presidential Library and Museum

distribution.title: White House Tapes of the Nixon Administration, 1971 to 1973: Conversation Lists
distribution.description: This webpage describes and hosts the high value dataset for the White House Tapes of the Nixon Administration.

distribution.title: 37-wht-dataset-conversationlist-2015-09-22.csv
distribution.description: This document is the comma-separated values (CSV) version of the White House Tapes dataset.  This CSV document offers details for all 22,723 conversations, including title, time and date of recording, recording device, geographic coordinates, participants, and a brief descriptive statement.

distribution.title: 37-wht-dataset-conversationlist-json-2015-09-22.zip
distribution.description: This zipped file contains 7 JSON documents for the White House Tapes dataset.  Each JSON file includes metadata about conversations that were recorded by a particular recording device.  These JSON documents offer details for all 22,723 conversations, including title, time and date of recording, recording device, geographic coordinates, participants, and a brief descriptive statement.
